thread.title: See what Hugh Jackman, Martha Stewart and more celebs are doing on #SnowDay2017
thread.title_full: See what Hugh Jackman, Martha Stewart and more celebs are doing on #SnowDay2017

author: Erin Jensen
title: See what Hugh Jackman, Martha Stewart and more celebs are doing on #SnowDay2017
text:
See what Hugh Jackman, Martha Stewart and more celebs are doing on #SnowDay2017 Erin Jensen, USA TODAY Published 1:15 p.m. ET Feb. 9, 2017 | Updated 4 hours ago 123 Shares 
Thursday's winter storm might be keping those in the Northeast from getting to work, school, or even stuck in an airport, but it didn't keep these celebs from tweeting about the event. — Hugh Jackman (@RealHughJackman) February 9, 2017 
Others shared photographs. We're hoping Martha Stewart found a crafty way to get out of the snow. I decided to plow now I am stuck darn pic.twitter.com/htdUI9iXfW — Martha Stewart (@MarthaStewart) February 9, 2017 
Some made jokes. I've got snowstorm jealousy. (And now I'll get @ replies from overly PC kids reminding me that old people die in snow storms.) — JEN KIRKMAN (@JenKirkman) February 9, 2017 I'm surprised Betsy DeVos hasn't publicly supported this snow storm yet as it's shutting down all local public schools. — Gideon Glick (@gidglick) February 9, 2017 
Joe Jonas tweeted Thursday's DNCE concert in Wallingford, Conn. was cancelled. Hey everyone, Unfortunately the show tonight is canceled. The roads and conditions are to dangerous for anyone to be on the roads. — J O E J O N A S (@joejonas) February 9, 2017 Stay safe and be smart. We will make our way back to play for you. Much love. -DNCE. — J O E J O N A S (@joejonas) February 9, 2017 
Hamilton , however, tweeted that its performance was still happening. Even in the snow, the revolution presses on. We're performing as planned this evening at #HamiltonBway ! #WaitForIt 
We also learned these Kinky Boots were made for walking (in the snow). Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2kTaQKP Most Popular
